contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox state representative | honorific-prefix = Representative | name = Mitch Gillespie | honorific-suffix = | image = | imagesize = | state_house = North Carolina | district = 85th | term_start = 1998<ref>[ftp://www.app.sboe.state.nc.us/data/ElectResults/1998_11_03/19981103_elected_candidate_list.pdf NC Board of Elections: 1998 General Election Candidate List]</ref><ref>[ftp://www.app.sboe.state.nc.us/data/ElectResults/1998_11_03/19981103_results_NC_House_49.pdf NC Board of Elections: 1998 General Election Results for NC House 49]</ref> | term_end = 2013 | preceded = [[Robert C. Hunter|Robert C. (Bob) Hunter]] | succeeded = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1959|8|19|mdf=y}} | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = | spouse = | party = [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] | relations = | children = | residence = [[Marion, North Carolina]] | alma_mater = [[Wake Technical Community College|Wake Technical]] | occupation = Small Business Owner | footnotes = [http://www.ncleg.net/gascripts/members/viewMember.pl?sChamber=H&nUserID=157 NCGA Website][http://votesmart.org/candidate/biography/21066/mitch-gillespie Project Vote Smart] }} '''Robert Mitchell Gillespie''' is an Assistant Secretary of the [[North Carolina Department of Environment and Natural Resources]], and a former [[United States Republican Party|Republican]] member of the [[North Carolina General Assembly]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ncga.state.nc.us/gascripts/members/viewMember.pl?nUserID=157&sChamber=H|title=Representative Mitch Gillespie (Republican, 2011-2012 Session)|publisher=[[North Carolina General Assembly]]|accessdate=31 March 2011}}</ref> He represented the eighty-fifth district in the [[North Carolina House of Representatives]], including constituents in [[Burke County, North Carolina|Burke]], [[Caldwell County, North Carolina|Caldwell]] and [[McDowell County, North Carolina|McDowell]] counties. A small business owner from [[Marion, North Carolina]], Gillespie served seven terms in the state House and was re-elected to an eighth term, but resigned to take his position in the executive branch in January 2013.<ref>[http://projects.newsobserver.com/under_the_dome/rep_gillespie_resigns News & Observer: Rep. Gillespie resigns]</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Gillespie, Mitch | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 19 August 1959 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gillespie, Mitch}} [[Category:Members of the North Carolina House of Representatives]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1959 births]] {{NorthCarolina-politician-stub}}
